publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1001# Carolyn Leckie: International Women's Day-That the Parliament notes that 8 March 2004 is International Women's Day and salutes the struggles of women throughout history and all over the world for a fair and democratic society; further notes the contribution that women in struggle make to the fight against women's oppression and for women's equality and liberty; notes that the struggle is being carried on today by, amongst others, the nursery nurses, the vast majority of whom are women, and considers that they are deserving of victory.

S2M-1001# Carolyn Leckie: International Women's Day-That the Parliament notes that 8 March 2004 is International Women's Day and salutes the struggles of women throughout history and all over the world for a fair and democratic society; further notes the contribution that women in struggle make to the fight against women's oppression and for women's equality and liberty; notes that the struggle is being carried on today by, amongst others, the nursery nurses, the vast majority of whom are women, and considers that they are deserving of victory. Supported by: Frances Curran*, Elaine Smith*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-1001# International Women’s Day (lodged on 4 March 2004) Campbell Martin*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-1001# International Women’s Day (lodged on 4 March 2004) Pauline McNeill*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Chris Ballance*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-1001# International Women’s Day (lodged on 4 March 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
